meanings.definition: Dense, compacted form of chromatin found in the nucleus of cells.
meanings.sent1: The heterochromatin in the cell nucleus looks tightly packed.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how heterochromatin affects cell functions.
meanings.sent3: The heterochromatin decided to throw a party, but no genes showed up.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like heterochromatin, tightly packed and difficult to access.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the heterochromatin resembled a dense forest, full of mysteries.

meanings.definition: Region of a chromosome that is highly condensed and transcriptionally inactive.
meanings.sent1: The heterochromatin on the chromosome appeared dark and dense.
meanings.sent2: During cell division, the heterochromatin remains inactive.
meanings.sent3: The heterochromatin section of the chromosome was the quiet neighborhood of genes.
meanings.sent4: In the story of genetics, the heterochromatin was the silent guardian of the chromosome.
meanings.sent5: The heterochromatin was like a locked vault, holding the secrets of genetic information.
